reviewText: As the twilight hours had long passed and the eager minutes marched to midnight I twiddled my fingertips on the remote for something to watch on Netflix last night.  As my enthusiasm began to wane and all hopes of entertainment seemed lost, I found Lo.Not knowing what to expect yet feeling the undeniable fascination with my peaking curiosity, I hit play.  After five fast minutes, I was intrigued.  After twenty more, I wanted more.  The next thing I knew, the movie was near an end and all I felt was the bitter disappointment in knowing that like true love and a joyous life, it all went too quickly.I initially rated this lustrous gem 4 stars but I must admit that at the time, I didn't know why Lo didn't deserve a five.  I didn't question this post-judgement mistake until the next day when I began to think about what movie would pass my hungry eyes this evening just as the night before.  It was then that I realized that Lo wasn't just a movie about one thing (love), it was also about another (the irrationality of love, the humour of it).My cardinal mistake when viewing this previously unheard of flick was that I thought it would be in the vein of other "violent demon movies" just as Netflix had described it in the suggestions box.  I was anticipating a gorefest of blood spilling across the smooth glass tv screen like exploding fat veins when I should have been ready for a dark, very dark, surreal love story with a comedic itch.  The simple truth is that as I viewed the movie I didn't know what to make of it until like being eaten by hungry quicksand, it all sunk in.Give it a try.  Chances are you'll be glad you did.Later.
summary: I Didn't Know What To Think...Until The Next Day
Title: N/A

reviewText: Lo is about a young man, when his girlfriend get dragged away by a demon he decides to use her hold book of magick to summon another demon to help find her. What follows is this bumbling youth turned occultist spending an evening talking with the demon Lo who tries to get him to leave his protective circle or to end the ritual while at the same time exploring love in general and also the young man, Justin's relationship with his girlfriend April, this is done in all from long philosophical debates to demons doing song and dance numbers.At first Lo is a bizarre film, in the beginning it reminded me of movies like Evil Bong and I was thinking what had the producers been smoking, I think that it is easy to dismiss this movie in the beginning as just a surrealist hodge podge, but stick with it the movie quickly becomes more serious and actually quite emotional, and also while the special effects budget was obviously not to big the atmosphere is creepy and some of the descriptions of hell is among the most scary I have ever heard. Like other reviewers have mentioned this movie is very low budget and it do have that indie feel to it, however I think those that made this film did terrific with what they had and they manage to blend horror and the absurd in a way that actually works.Now I almost gave Lo a 5, however there are a few things that pull it down. First off all while the movie maker manage to in most cases balance the absurd with the horrific at times the film to wander into acid trip land and some of the musical numbers can stretch on to long, also while Lo itself is well done in terms of costume and make up the other creatures can get a bit on the silly side, however all in all for a indie production like this you really can not complain, though I would have preferred less silly costumes on the other demons when the production obviously spent all their special effects budget(and rightfully so) on Lo, the other creatures should have been done more simply to avoid them looking like costumes from the local supermarket.The music in Lo is good and set of the mood of the movie perfectly, the story is well phased and kept my attention all though the movie, the characters are likable though the actor that plays Justin overplays him a bit, Lo, the character, is perfect, both repulsing and charismatic. Also this movie managed to do something movies seldom do for me, especially cheap horror movies, it gave me a real emotional response, and for all these reasons I can not recommend Lo enough.
summary: An exploration of love through the eyes of a demon.

reviewText: A love story / horror movie done (mostly) in the form of a stage play, LO is a refreshing take on the demon film. The devilish wit and (intentionally) cheeezy sets make for a light-hearted, yet decidedly dark viewing experience. LO himself (itself) is a great looking creature, a ghoulish delight for the monster freak! LO's attitude is fittingly twisted and sarcastic, about the way you'd expect an imp to behave. As for the central theme of "love never dies", well, let's just say that it gets a nice, overdue kick in the pants! Enjoy...
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am beside myself with joy right now.If you can believe it... I am actually smiling like a circus-clown psychotic as I type this!!I have nothing I can compare this movie to.(proof that originality isn't dead)Clive Barkers Yatterking & Jack or Mister B. Gone, with & Evil Dead-ish  influencesmixed with the first chapter of Gaiman's The Sandman, perhaps?  If that makes any quantity of sense.Hennenlotter in Hell, maybe?Anyway, it's as effective as any Tim Burton flick.(only other film-maker I can think of who makes movies with strong elements of horror, comedy & romance)with MUUUUUCH less of a budget.What!?!?!Don't believe me??I can't freakin' believe me either!!!Trust me I'm dumbfounded.Jaw down by my knees - dumb-founded.There was even a hilarious music video at one point.I swear to god a music video!!!A romantic horredy, what looks like a stage play,about a man who summons the demon Lo to retrieve his girlfriend from Hell...his girlfriend who was kidnapped by another demon from his bed one night.but the demon Lo has other plans... namely dinner.And can I just say, what an impressive looking demon Lo is.It's not often you get to see such great make-up effects as this, so definitely take it in.It is even more beautifully grotesque than the cover-art depicts. = )The whole movie takes place in a pitch black Hell surrounding a man in a pentagram,one which he can't step out of, as Hell is kind of a dangerous place.The flashbacks of lover-boys past,of his time spent with his girlfriend,is played out as hokey stage plays (obviously comedic)But it's a fantastic film that keeps your attention till the end.... by which time it has your heart.Everyone here can act.The dialogue is funny.The characters quirky.The demons are well... demonic eye candy,The atmosphere is bleak,The whole affair was very effective.I laughed, I stared wide-eyed, and then I got choked the H311 up.This is the first film I've seen from Travis (Joshua) Betz, but it certainly won't be the last.Bra-freakin'-vo!!!!!5 out of 510 out 10100 out of 100MORAL OF THE STORY:If you love something you have to let it go.......... TO HELL!!!!ALSO RECOMMENDED:Joshua, Ink, Dante's Inferno, City of Lost Children, Delicatessen, Pans Labyrinth, Dark City, The Crow, Tideland, Evil Dead 2, Labyrinth, Dark Crystal,(all of which are only kind of comparable, this movie has a vibe all its own)
Title: N/A

reviewText: Holy!?!?  Is it truly possible?  A demonically horrific comedy that is hellbent of all earthly cinematic formulas?  One that grips what's left of your gooey feeble little mind that's been hammered by the onslaught of money-grabbing horror remakes and destroys all preconceptions?  Why yes!  There is a slight glimmer of hope for American horror.It's been summoned to the screen by director/writer Travis Betz.  Using a wicked book of spells and chants, a love-stricken boyfriend calls upon the demon Lo to help him retrieve his beloved woman, who was snatched from his bedroom by another foul and mysterious creature.  Lo has an agenda of his own, as all demons are naturally inclined to rape, torture, and devour anything in sight.  So we've got an evil game of tug o' war, or perhaps a devilish chess match.Lo plays mind games while hurling insults at his new master.  He also projects his own mental images on the wall of his interpretations of the couples past.  It plays out like an absurd Broadway play, funny as all hell and definitely strange.I must admit at first I was disappointed when seeing this horribly evil and frightening looking demon crack jokes and spread on the extreme sarcasm.  I'd love to see Lo in a straight-up horror film.  But, there were just too many hilarious moments for me to hold a grudge.  Way too fun!Lo has to be one of the most original and entertaining horror films to come out ever.  There will be hell to pay if you miss this great independent flick.  Madness, I tell you.  Madness!
summary: Lo and behold--an American horror film worth dying for!

reviewText: Lo, the demon, has been summoned by a lovelorn Justin (Ward Roberts) who uses a spell from a necronomicon-esque book which involves spilt blood from self infliction while sitting in a painted pentagram on the floor of his apt.Lo makes his appearance with a convincing and beautiful mask and make up, grade A for a low0-budget film, while crawling across the floor to the edge of the pentagram. Lo's growling scratchy voice makes some loud evil breaths and then proceeds with some suprising comedic lines that are equivalent to a contemptuous late night talk show host.Justin summoned Lo to help him aquire his lost girlfriend, (the beautiful Sarah Lassez) who was taken by another demon. The story proceeds in a play-like fashion with impressive looking demons, that also crack one-liners and torment Justin in song and dance fashion with such a tone you feel the absence of the evil and scares that would be expected by a film with such a demonic intro. Lo continues to extract memories from Justin and his girlfriend and they are seen as two-dimensional like, a less quirky Sienfeld episode with laugh-track and silly music ques included.If horror influenced comedy-dramas, set in a one room play format become the next big thing in independent cinema than Lo will be considered a groundbreaking film and the director Travis Betz will be regarded as a genius. However if viewers are not used to play like formats with tounge-in-cheek humor from cigarette smoking, pop corn munching, F-bomb dropping minions from hell then this may have a hard time finding it's proper audience.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Lo is a wonderful little movie that blends the horror genre with a love story, sprinkled heavily with dark humor and a slight pinch of moral values!  In a way, as the movie plays out, there are certain aspects that reminded me of the now defunct but wonderful little series 'Pushing Daisies'.  You'll have to see both to maybe see what I am talking about.  Don't expect any one genre to overbear the others in the homogenous blend.  It is so quirky and entertaining that it will find itself in my library soon... and I do highly recommend a look-see for all who enjoy movies like 'Ink', or the series 'Pushing Daisies'.  I won't give anything away, but though you may have questions along the way, they will all be answered at the end.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Minimalistic, to say the least, this movie takes place in darkness with one light source.  It basically features just two characters verbally sparring, a few "guest" stars thrown in for good measure.  Supposedly, it's about a testament of true love.  I, however, saw it more as a stubborn man clinging to the one opportunity he had at love, but lost, through no fault of his own.  Trying to retrieve it proved more daunting than he ever considered.  Some things you lose, you don't get back.At first glance, this seems like a one joke premise played entirely for laughs (that don't always come naturally).  But I have to admit, it grew on me and I soon caught myself chuckling.  It's bizarre, yes, and some of the routines don't work, but the punch at the end helps (even though it's pretty obvious at the start where this confrontation is leading).Whatever else, it is weird.  I've never seen anything quite like it.  There's nothing that I can think of to compare it to, and that's a good thing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: ... Horror?  Romance?  Comedy?Still trying to figure that out.  But it was complex, well acted and generally excellent.A guy is assaulted and his girlfriend taken by a demon, so he summons a demon, Lo, to find her in hell.  As Lo bandies legs with him, his flashbacks (as edited by Lo), provide the context for his request and the story.  His hand starts talking to him.  Then it gets weird.While their aren't many characters, the character development makes up for it.  Even demons have more layers than one would normally expect.  Our lead is a love struck fool who is ready to follow the love of his life into Hell, but by the end, he shows that he is capable of more than just simpering and whining.  Lo, the demon, is cynical, suspicious, cruel, and communicates an interest range of emotion, despite the makeup and limits of the role.While clearly a limited budget flick, the script and acting make up for the limitations.  There was demons, hell, romance, and comedy.  I'm not sure which genre it belongs in, but I enjoyed the heck out of it.E.M. Van Court
Title: N/A

reviewText: Well........I can't say I was as nuts about this film as were some others but I did find it interesting and a decent early effort by writer/director Travis Betz. He only has a few other projects under his belt so he knew enough what he had to do to get Lo done with, what must have been, a tiny budget.It seems a large part of the budget was making the costumes for Lo, Jeez and a 3rd demon who's name I do not know. Said costumes all actually decent with Lo's being the best. Other than that you have 5 sets with some peculiar lighting with the main set consisting of a small area of floor with a pentagle painted on it. All around it is total black so they could have shot that in someone's basement and the viewer would be none the wiser.The story is OK. A guy summons a demon to go to hell, find his girlfriend, and bring her back to him. Of course things get a bit more complicated and all is not as it seems.With a movie like this it's all in the writing and acting. The acting is OK. I was rather surprised at the number of projects some of the actors had under their belts before they got to this one. The story is OK. What helps make it is the twist ending. Where it suffers is in the writing. I get the whole infusion of humor into the dialogue thing which is a staple in a lot of horror movies. But here the humor isn't that clever and some of the rest of the dialogue is unnecessarily course which undercuts the overall feeling and direction of things.As I said. This is a good early effort. I hope Betz watches this over and over to see where he went right and where he went wrong so he can punch up his next effort a few more notches.

reviewText: Many of my relationships end up like this: sitting in a dark room facing various demons. This is less a horror flick, more a documentary about love, not to mention all that icky stuff we don't feel inclined to share on the first date.Young people, this will help you understand how relationships actually work. Then when similar things happen to you, instead of being filled with terrible despair, you'll be like, "Hey, cool, I remember this experience from that movie. Maybe there will be a tomorrow." Old people, this is a trip down memory lane. "Yep, I dated him/her."
Title: N/A

reviewText: 3 1/2 Stars = Very GoodWhat do you do when your girlfriend is kidnapped by demons? Why summon "Lo" of course!"LO" has to be one of the most ingenious films I've seen in a long time, for a budget the size of the cost of a used car, & not a luxury model either! I mean this is as bare bones as it gets, yet the make up is well done (probably the biggest part of the budget), the script is very witty, with large amounts of very good tongue in cheek, black hearted comedy. The title might even be a pun on the budget?"Lo's" acting is very competent, especially Jeremiah Birkett, who as "Lo," does the best Ron Pearlman imitation I've seen, absolute perfection. I mean this character could've been written for Pearlman, that is, if this film had the budget. Ward Roberts as Justin, the love forlorn inept boyfriend of missing "April," plays his part very well. He kind of reminds me a little of Bruce Campbell of the "Evil Dead" series, but does not have Campbell's comedic range, nor charisma. Then there is "April," Sarah Lassez, who may or may not be human? Her acting style in this film is a dead ringer for Liv Tyler's performance as the dizzy dame with an agenda in, "One Night at McCool's." This girl has a future, & it does not hurt that she's quite alluring too!The only thing that knocks this film down a half star from classic status, is the severely limited production. The film plays out like a theater performance stage production on film. Maybe I shouldn't knock it down a half of star for that, but I do, because I could just imagine what this film would be like with a budget, with the same director, writer, & actors, given more room & money to create . It could've been astounding, though it's pretty astounding for what it achieves with so little!You could do a lot worse than checking out this "Lo" budget film!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a low budget horror film done right.  Justin summons the demon Lo after his girlfriend April is kidnapped by demons and tried to force Lo to free her.Shot almost entirely on a black soundstage the action is built arund Justin's growing madness and Lo's lies and tricks.  There is a very good twist early on, and the story of April and Justin is retold though some surreal performances.Two things deserve special praise, the acting is good throughout, with Ward Roberts as Justin in particular doing a great job.  The make up effects on Lo and the other demons are also top-notch.But the plot still feels thin and after a while the single set feels a bit claustrophobic.  The early twist is great, but nothing after that quite lives up to its promise.Still it's one of the best horror films I've seen in a while and is really worth seeing.

reviewText: Since I got my Netflix account back a year ago, I began pouring through all the movies on instant watch that might be worth watching, and somehow, I think this came up as a suggestion, and although I am not sure why, I do not regret watching it.  The movie exceeded and went under my expectations, it failed in that I was not prepared for just how low budget and campy this film would be, and it succeeded in a way I did not expect, with a strong sense of mood and isolation and a very good climax.Basically, this movie is filmed in one room for most of the film and is shot as if it were a play, this is because the main character who has gone down to hell, hopefully to retrieve his girlfriend, is stuck in a protective circle and thus is stuck in the same place for the whole film and since its completely pitch black and nothing is visible except the actors, it does create a very good mood of isolation, which may seem odd for a film about a trip to hell, but for Lo, I think that is part of its strength (and weakness), I could see it being an amazing stage play to be honest, having been in a decent amount of theater myself, I could definitely see this is a quirky Off-Broadway show.Since its not a play and this is a film, while the film is interesting it is at times dull, and this is where the whole movie taking place in a pitch black room is a serious detriment to this being a really good movie, as it is, I would say its slightly above average, I personally found it to be memorable, I still have that darn "You're Going to Hell" song in my head as bad as it is.  Now there are a few scenes where the character is basically watching back snippets of his life with his girlfriend and it is literally in the form of a play on a stage in front of him (actually, I thought it was a very interesting concept and worked pretty well) and this does break of the monotomy of the movie.Overall, for what it is, a silly yet serious and kind of goofy movie about a guy's girl who gets literally dragged to hell and he has to find a way to rescue her and being filmed mostly in a single room, I give it 3 and 1/2 stars.  The acting by the main actor was a little over the top theatrical, but I loved Lo's character, the actor who played him was awesome, while some of the other demons were just annoying, such as the gay nazi demon, once all was revealed at the end, he became a bit more amusing, but not by much.If you are in to off the wall films that are not mainstream and are low budget, a bit campy, and slightly stagey, then Lo will be right up your alley!  If you are looking for a cookie cutter blockbuster, then run screaming in the other direction because you probably will not even remotely enjoy this.God Bless ~Amy
summary: VERY Low Budget, but Not Bad for What it is.

reviewText: "LO" has got to be the most original movie I have seen in a LONG time, and that alone makes it worth watching. ANYONE who loves cult/independent movies are in for a treat with this one!Story is simple enough,  A smitten young man loses his girlfriend to demons. Desperate to find her and bring her back, he summons the demon Lo from a ritual in a book the girl has left behind.LO (Jerehmiah Burkett) is a cool demon creation and very well played, both scary, funny and UGLY!!!!I won't give away too much about the story; you have to see it! Along the "way" in his search, Justin meets with some other bizarre characters and demons, including a rather effeminate reptilian demon named Jeez, who sings in a demon rock band!!!The makeup effects vary, some are good (Lo himself, also Jeez), and bad, (Justin's talking hand), but thankfully NO CGI, which is often WAY overused in movies like this. Very refreshing to see a  movie that doesn't rely on CGI.The strong points of the movie are the actors themselves, and the writing. Plus it all takes place in a darkened room where Justin sits in a protective circle he created to keep the demons away from him.Lo himself is a delighful character, he is funny, sarcastic, and definately dangerous as well! He repeatedly taunts and fools Justin into frustration in the hopes Justin will accidentally breech the protective circle. Lo keeps teling him "Im Hungry!"This is great stuff, so refreshing in its originality, which is what makes it so great. I can't give too much away about the story because I don't want to ruin it for potential viewers. All I can say is SEE IT!!!!!

reviewText: This movie was creepy, funny, crazy, and romantic all at the same time. It was better than I was expecting. A man named Justin uses a book in order to contact a demon named Lo. Justin asks Lo to search the fiery pits of Hell in order to find his girlfriend, April. When Lo tells Justin about April's demonic past, he will have to face singing demons, talking hands, dancing bartenders and human sized rats in order to get her back. His love for her is put to the ultimate test. I highly recommend LO!!!
summary: One Hell of a Love Story!!!

reviewText: Lo is a great idea: a heartbroken man conjures a demon to help him bring back the lover who was snatched away by demons conveyed almost entirely in a black box theater format.  It's a dialogue-driven exercise that had a lot of potential.  Its low-budget effects are forgiveable, but the acting isn't.  The demon Lo, played by Jeremiah Birkett under some serious latex, is fine and engaging. But the rest of the cast? Ugh.This film could have worked with the exact same production values and script (minus the completely unnecessary musical numbers) if the director had taken the time to lobby some good actors.  As it stands, it's just a great idea that, unfortunately, came to the wrong guy.
summary: Great idea marred by pitiful direction

reviewText: No SpoilersLo was a very creative outing made on a shoestring budget and it made quite the impression. I first saw it late one night and had to pick up the DVD because it was worth a repeat.The concept is simple enough. A man lost his love to what appeared to be a demon and utilized a book he had been given for Christmas to summon the demon, Lo. Sitting in a circle, somewhat protected, he tries to persuade Lo to tell locate April and bring her back to him. Things get - interesting - as Lo divulges more about exactly what transpired.The movie is constructed much like a play. In fact,think of it as a play with portions zoomed in one and effects you can see much better than if you you were seated in the audience. You would think that this would be a downside but it was, in fact, very refreshing. The creature, Lo, looked good and the dialog between the seeker and Lo was good. In some place Lo was mean and in others he was funny or mocking or downright cruel. Kind of like a demon should be. add in some interesting sound and a nice plot loop and you have a good story. Other demons also pop in and add everything from the strange to the musical to tell a story that explain so much. Flashbacks happen in set-ups and the movie does not try to hit the way its made. It embraces it, turning it into part of the movie.Most movies like this would undoubtedly fail because they would try another approach and not focus on the dialog or the humor needed. That is one reason i found this movie good. Know the limitations beforehand, it really does help. 4.5/5
Title: N/A
